H0.text: The nervous system is the body system responsible for transmitting, processing, and responding to most of the sensory information created by various stimuli.

H1.text: The respiratory system is responsible for transmitting, processing, and responding to most of the sensory information that is created by various stimuli.

H2.text: The circulatory system is responsible for transmitting, processing, and responding to most of the sensory information that is created by various stimuli.

H3.text: The attentive system is responsible for transmitting, processing, and responding to most of the sensory information that is created by various stimuli.

A4.text: The primary function of the nervous system is to control the body by extracting information from the environment, sending signals to the central nervous system, processing the information, and sending output signals to muscles or glands.

A5.text: The nervous system detects environmental changes that impact the body and works in tandem with the endocrine system to respond to such events.
